results.title: Agnes, Maude and Pearly too
results.creator_credit: Kate Gillick, Charles Mitchell, Aline Jacques, Erica Glynn and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
On this day, in loving memory of Pearly, Agnes and Maude play a game on Pearly’s favourite poker machine. But when they hit the jackpot, money isn’t the only thing that comes spilling out.
Cast: Julie Godfrey (Agnes), Jacquy Phillips (Maude)

results.title: Not the chosen one
results.creator_credit: William Trumble, Jeremy Parker and Yongki Liawinata
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn computer animation tells a story of a lonely man yearning for a lover. As the cold winter months pass into spring, his snowman companion melts into a woman. The man pursues the woman to discover he isn’t the chosen one and then becomes seduced by a frog.

results.title: Deeth treo
results.brief_description: A surreal cut-out animation of a lone horse seen travelling the desert with a mortally wounded knight strapped to his back. The horse in collusion with the tree delivers the corpse to sate the tree’s canabalistic desires. A black comedy.
results.description: A surreal cut-out animation of a lone horse seen travelling the desert with a mortally wounded knight strapped to his back. The horse in collusion with the tree delivers the corpse to sate the tree’s canabalistic desires. A black comedy.

results.title: Thou shalt not...kill
results.brief_description: Thou Shalt Not Kill is a black and white cut-out animation. A priest and larrikan ride together as passengers on a train through the countryside. The larrikans’ pranks and vibrant antics play on the priests patience to test his self-control and moral beliefs…especially the one about ‘Thou Shalt Not Kill’.
results.description: Thou Shalt Not Kill is a black and white cut-out animation. A priest and larrikan ride together as passengers on a train through the countryside. results.title: World #37...previsited
results.brief_description: World #37…previsited is a 3D computer animation (created on 3D Studio 4) of a futuristic city run by warring armed robotic soldiers. The film initially navigates the viewer through the city absent of people to focus on the only visible inhabitants being the robotic soldiers who begin to march to war. The 3D Cafe (Platinum Pictures) made the original models for the mountains, trees, the colossal statue, dragon gargoyles and robot’s skirts and boots.

results.title: The Great Australian cultural exchange programme
results.brief_description: A humourous hand-drawn 2D computer animation of newly arrived Chinese immigrants being chased through the landscape by a ‘banana in pyjamas’, B0, as opposed to B1 and B2 of the ABC childrens program Bananas in Pyjamas.

results.title: Octikuki
results.brief_description: Octikuki uses 2D and 3D computer animation to create a futuristic creation scene. The animation plays with themes nature and science reading as a visual poem. The music soundtrack ‘Sweet Thunder’ is by Yello.

results.title: The Albatross
results.brief_description: This claymation tells the story of a lone desert dweller. The ‘humanoid’ animal one day comes across an injured albatross and sets about to nurture the bird back to health. Later in her explorations of the day she comes across a caged and abandoned male counterpart and proceeds to help him also. On contact with the male she telepathically sees the mans troubled past (the cause of his present condition) and responds with empathy and friendship.
